{{Infobox building |name = One New York Plaza |status = Complete |image = 1 New York Plz fr MWGW E of BSt jeh.jpg |image_size = 225px |caption = East and south sides |location = 1 New York Plaza, [[Manhattan]], [[New York (state)|New York]] 10004, [[United States]] |coordinates = {{Coord|40.70214|N|74.01175|W|scale:1000_region:US|display=inline,title}} |start_date = 1967 |completion_date = 1969 |architect = [[Kahn & Jacobs]], [[William Lescaze|Lescaze & Associates]] |owner = [[Brookfield Office Properties]] |cost = |floor_area = {{convert|2587000|sqft|m2|abbr=on}} |top_floor = |floor_count = 50 |references = |map_type = Lower Manhattan#New York |building_type = Office | architectural_style = [[Modernist]] | renovation_date = 2014 |antenna_spire = |roof = 640 ft (195 m) |elevator_count = 45 |structural_engineer= Aaron Garfinkel & Associates |main_contractor = [[George A. Fuller|George A. Fuller Company]] |pushpin_label =1 New York Plaza |opening = 1970 |developer = Atlas-McGrath |management = }} '''1 New York Plaza''' is an office building in [[New York City]]'s [[Financial District, Manhattan|Financial District]], built in 1969 at the intersection of [[South Street (Manhattan)|South]] and [[Whitehall Street]]s. It is the southernmost of all [[Manhattan]] [[skyscrapers]].
The building is 640 feet (195 m) tall with 50 floors. The building was designed by [[William Lescaze]] & Assocs. and [[Kahn & Jacobs]]. The building has 2.556 million square feet of office space. There is a {{convert|40,000|ft2|m2}} retail concourse on the lower level.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://brookfieldofficeproperties.com/us/new-york/one-new-york-plaza |title=One New York Plaza in New York - New York |publisher=Brookfield Office Properties |date= |accessdate=2014-02-25}}</ref>
The facade was designed by Nevio Maggiora, consisting of a boxlike "beehive" pattern with the windows recessed within, made of aluminum-clad wall elements resembling a type of thermally activated elevator button popular at the time of construction.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/956992385|title=Europe meets America : William Lescaze, architect of modern housing|author=Gaia Caramellino|year=2016|publisher=Cambridge Scholars Publishing|accessdate=27 August 2018}}</ref>
Notable former occupants of One New York Plaza include [[Salomon Brothers]] in its heyday and [[Goldman Sachs]],<ref name="steam" /> while current tenants are [[Fried, Frank, Harris, Shriver & Jacobson]]<ref name="steam">{{ cite news |title=Burst Pipes Halt Goldman's Nasdaq Trading |publisher=Fox News.com |url=http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,32005,00.html | date=August 13, 2001 }}</ref> [[Morgan Stanley]],<ref name="ms">{{cite news |title = Morgan Stanley to Move 2,300 Employees Downtown |publisher = LowerManhattan.info |year = 2005 |url = http://www.lowermanhattan.info/news/morgan_stanley_to_move_52052.aspx |access-date = 2008-07-11 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20091028030602/http://www.lowermanhattan.info/news/morgan_stanley_to_move_52052.aspx |archive-date = 2009-10-28 |dead-url = yes |df = }}</ref> and [[Nature Publishing Group]].<ref>{{Cite web|title = New NYC Space for Macmillan Unit|url = http://www.publishersweekly.com/pw/by-topic/industry-news/publisher-news/article/61580-new-nyc-space-for-macmillan-science-and-education.html|website = PublishersWeekly.com|accessdate = 2015-10-26}}</ref>
==History== [[Image:One New York Plaza.jpg|thumb|left|200px|North facade]]
In 1959, the City of New York attempted to acquire the land under this development through [[eminent domain]] as part of the [[Battery Park]] Urban Renewal Area. The plan involved consolidating several blocks into a "[[City block|superblock]]" for [[public housing]]. When that plan fell through, the city hoped to entice the [[New York Stock Exchange]] to relocate to the property. However, the owner of the property—the firm of Atlas McGrath—successfully sued to retain their land, claiming they were more than willing to develop the site privately.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nyc-architecture.com/LM/LM024-ONENEWYORKPLAZA.htm |title=New York Architecture Images-ONE NEW YORK PLAZA |publisher=Nyc-architecture.com |date= |accessdate=2014-02-25}}</ref>
The building was renovated in 1994, and repainted from a dark black and grey color scheme to a lighter white and light grey.
The building was used in the 2014 film [[The Other Woman (2014 film)|The Other Woman]].{{cn|date=August 2018}}
=== Incidents === On August 5, 1970, the building suffered a fire in which two people were killed and 35 injured. The deaths were caused after an occupied elevator was "summoned" to the burning floor when one of the thermally-activated call buttons—designed to react to a warm finger tapping it—reacted instead to the heat of the fire on that floor.<ref>{{cite news |last=Lipton |first=Eric |authorlink=Eric Lipton |last2=Glanz |first2=James |authorlink2=James Glanz |date=2002-04-02 |title=U.S. Report on Trade Center Echoes Lessons of Past Disasters |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2002/04/02/nyregion/02TOWE.html |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |access-date=2015-07-20 }}</ref>
One New York Plaza's air-conditioning chiller depends on Con Ed's [[New York City steam system]].<ref name="chiller">{{cite web |title=One New York Plaza Building Specifications |publisher=Brookfield Properties |accessdate=2011-03-29 |format=PDF |url=http://www.brookfieldofficeproperties.com/_Global/25/documents/relatedlinks/1854.pdf }}</ref> On August 11, 2001, a steam turbine failed in the basement, and the damage from the resulting explosion disrupted Goldman's market-making [[NASDAQ]] activities for the day.<ref name="steam"/>
In October 2012, the building was heavily damaged by [[Hurricane Sandy]]. An estimated 23 million gallons of water flooded the lower levels of the building. The retail concourse was submerged and needed to be completely gut-renovated. Office tenants were allowed to return starting November 17, 2012,<ref>{{cite web|last=Barbarino |first=Al |url=http://commercialobserver.com/2012/12/one-new-york-plaza-retail-space-razed-and-to-be-rebuilt-post-sandy/ |title=One New York Plaza Retail Concourse to Be Rebuilt After Post-Sandy Flooding |publisher=Commercial Observer |date=2013-01-11 |accessdate=2014-02-25}}</ref> and the retail concourse reopened in the winter of 2014.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://commercialobserver.com/2014/06/brookfield-secures-retro-fitness-as-1-new-york-plaza-tenant/ | title=Brookfield Secures Retro Fitness as 1 New York Plaza Tenant | work=Commercial Observer | date=5 June 2014 | accessdate=17 March 2015 | author=Henderson, Jennifer}}</ref>

{{for|the Indian film director|Ananda Krishnan (director)}} {{EngvarB|date=September 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2014}} {{Indian name|Tatparanandam Ananda|Krishnan}} {{Infobox person | name = Ananda Krishnan | image = | image_size = | caption = Tatparanandam Ananda Krishnan | native_name = த. ஆனந்தகிருஷ்ணன் | citizenship = Malaysia | native_name_lang = [[Tamil language]] | birth_name = Tatparanandam Ananda Krishnan | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1938|4|1}} | birth_place = [[Brickfields]], [[Kuala Lumpur]], [[British Malaya]] (modern-day [[Malaysia]]) | death_date = | death_place = | known_for = | occupation = Sole Shareholder & Chairman, PanOcean Management Ltd
Chairman, [[Usaha Tegas|Usaha Tegas Sdn Bhd]] | salary = | networth = {{gain}} $6.4 billion (2018){{cite web|title= Forbes List of Billionaires 2011 |author=|author2= |url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/ananda-krishnan/|publisher=[[Forbes]] |accessdate=20 February 2012}} | spouse = | children = 3 | website = | footnotes = }} '''Tatparanandam Ananda Krishnan''' ([[Tamil language|Tamil]]: த. ஆனந்தகிருஷ்ணன்) (born 1 April 1938) is a Malaysian businessman and philanthropist, the Chairman of Usaha Tegas Sdn Bhd{{Cite web|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=40175527&privcapId=45733736|title=Bloomberg - Are you a robot?|website=www.bloomberg.com|access-date=2018-11-11}} and founder of Yu Cai Foundation (YCF).{{Cite web|url=https://themalaysianreserve.com/2017/03/31/tycoon-ananda-krishnan-launches-yu-cai-foundation/|title=Tycoon Ananda Krishnan, launches Yu Cai Foundation - The Malaysian Reserve|website=themalaysianreserve.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-11-11}} Nicknamed '''A.K.''', {{As of|2011|alt=currently}} he is estimated to have a net worth of US$7.1 billion{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/ananda-krishnan/?list=malaysia-billionaires#1e075fff7f4b|title=Ananda Krishnan|work=Forbes|access-date=2018-11-11|language=en}} according to ''Forbes''{{'}} latest annual list of wealthiest people, making him the third-wealthiest in Malaysia and number 217 in the world.{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/ananda-krishnan/|title=Ananda Krishnan|work=Forbes|access-date=2018-11-11|language=en}} Ananda Krishnan shuns public exposure{{cite web|title= Who is Ananda Krishnan?|url=http://sundaytimes.lk/070527/News/nws14.html|date=27 May 2007|publisher=Sundaytimes |accessdate=26 May 2008| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20080513230444/http://sundaytimes.lk/070527/News/nws14.html| archivedate= 13 May 2008 | deadurl= no}} and is known to maintain a low profile for a person of his stature. The [[Central Bureau of Investigation|Central Bureau of Investigation of India]] sought arrest warrants for Ananda Krishnan for [[money laundering]]{{cite web|title= India's CBI seeks arrest warrants for Ananda Krishnan, three others |url=http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2016/08/02/india-central-bureau-investigations-arrest-warrants-against-ananda-krishnan/|date=2 August 2016|last=Kanyakumari|first=D.|publisher=The Star |accessdate=2 August 2016}} and was involved with financing the controversial [[1Malaysia Development Berhad|1MDB]].{{cite web|title= 1MDB repays RM2b loan arranged by tycoon Ananda Krishnan |url=http://m.malaysiakini.com/news/338229 |date=18 April 2016|publisher=Malaysiakini |accessdate= 18 April 2016 | deadurl= no}} ==Biography== Ananda Krishnan was born in 1938 in [[Brickfields]], Kuala Lumpur to [[Tamil people|Tamil]] parents, who were of [[Sri Lankan Tamils|Sri Lankan]] origin. He studied at Vivekananda Tamil School in Brickfields and furthered his studies at [[Victoria Institution]], Kuala Lumpur. Later, as a [[Colombo Plan]] scholar, he attended the [[University of Melbourne]], Australia for his B.A. (Honours) degree majoring in political science. During that time he boarded in the [[Melbourne]] suburb of [[Hawthorn, Victoria|Hawthorn]]. Following that, Krishnan obtained a [[Master of Business Administration|Masters in Business Administration]] from [[Harvard Business School]], graduating in 1964.{{cite web|title= Ananda Krishnan |author=|author2= |url=https://www.forbes.com/lists/2006/10/YK1N.html|publisher=[[Forbes]] |accessdate=26 May 2008| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20080518063321/http://www.forbes.com/lists/2006/10/YK1N.html| archivedate= 18 May 2008 | deadurl= no}} Krishnan has two daughters and a son who is also a [[Theravada]] Buddhist monk known as Ajahn Siripanyo.{{cite web|title=The monk who flew in a jet |url=http://www.businessbhutan.bt/?p=3954 |publisher=Business Bhutan |date=1 January 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160720090028/http://businessbhutan.bt/the-monk-who-flew-in-a-jet/ |archivedate=20 July 2016 |deadurl=no |accessdate=25 December 2015 }}{{cite web|title=Ananda Krishnan makes time for son|last=Chow|first=Tan Sin|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2012/04/24/ananda-krishnan-makes-time-for-son/|date=24 April 2012|publisher=The Star |accessdate=25 December 2015}} ==Entrepreneurship== Krishnan's first entrepreneurial venture was a [[Malaysia]]n consultancy MAI Holdings Sdn Bhd. He set up Exoil Trading, which went on to purchase oil drilling concessions in various countries. Later, he moved into gambling (in Malaysia). In the early part of the 1990s, he started diversifying into the multimedia arena. Currently, he has business interests in media ([[Astro (television)|Astro]], Johnston Press Plc), satellite ([[MEASAT Satellite Systems|MEASAT]], [[SES S.A.|SES]]), oil and gas (Bumi Armada, Pexco), telecommunications ([[Maxis Communications|Maxis]], [[Aircel]], [[AXIS Telekom Indonesia|Axis]], [[Sri Lanka Telecom]]). He owns stakes in [[Tanjong|Tanjong Public Limited Company]], an investment holding company with subsidiaries involved in power generation ([[Powertek]]), gaming (Pan Malaysian Pools), leisure (tropical islands, [[TGV Cinemas]]) and property (67% Maxis Tower etc.). == Multimedia == Krishnan first came to prominence by helping to organise the Live Aid concert with Bob Geldof in the mid-1980s. In the early 1990s, he began building a multimedia empire that now includes two telecommunication companies—[[Maxis Communications]], [[MEASAT Satellite Systems|MEASAT Broadcast Network Systems]] and [[SES World Skies]]—and has three communication satellites circumnavigating the earth. He effected the purchase of 46% of [[Maxis Communications]], the country's largest cellular phone company, from [[América Móvil]], [[AT&T Corporation]], [[BT Group|British Telecom]], [[Proximus Group|Belgacom]], [[Ooredoo]], [[Orange S.A.]] and [[KPN|Royal KPN N.V.]] for $1,180 million—raising his stake to 70%. Maxis has more than ten million subscribers, with around 40% market share in Malaysia. He also owns stakes in [[Aircel]], [[AXIS Telekom Indonesia|Axis]] and [[Sri Lanka Telecom]]. In an agreement between [[Astro (Malaysian satellite television)|Astro]] and India's [[Sun Network]], Krishnan plans to produce TV channels which cater to the Indian market, especially [[Tamils|Tamil people]] in countries such as US, Western Europe and Middle East. He also plans to offer TV services featuring Web-based interactivity. Ananda Krishnan owns stakes in [[TVB]].com and the [[List of Shaw Brothers films|Shaw Brothers]] movie archives. == Philanthropy == Ananda Krishnan donates to education{{Cite web|url=https://www.therichest.com/celebnetworth/celebrity-business/men/ananda-krishnan-net-worth/|title=Ananda Krishnan Net Worth {{!}} TheRichest|website=www.therichest.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-11-12}}, the arts, sports and humanitarian causes in Malaysia through his company Usaha Tegas, and its subsidiaries.{{Cite news|url=http://www.focusmalaysia.my/Mainstream/charitable-tycoons|title=Charitable tycoons|work=Focus Malaysia|access-date=2018-11-12}} His philanthropic work is largely focused on developing talent in Malaysia by offering scholarships and supporting school programs. He funds the development of internet boot camps for rural high schools, supports Malaysian equestrian sportsmen and Olympic athletes, and offers stipends for local children studying Indian classical dance and music. One of his first  charity acts was contributing to the organization of the 1985 Live Aid rock concert, which raised $240 million for African famine relief.{{Cite news|url=https://pagalavan.com/politics/heroes-of-philanthropy/|title=Heroes of Philanthropy|date=2010-03-08|work=Pagalavan's Avatar|access-date=2018-11-12|language=en-US}} In 2003 Krishnan's Usaha Tegas launched the Harapan Nusantara education fund. Since 2004 the fund has sponsored 100 students a year to attend special programs at local private universities that collaborate with foreign universities.{{Cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2003/06/26/harapan-nusantara-puts-up-rm100m-to-benefit-malay-students/|title=Harapan Nusantara puts up RM100m to benefit Malay students - Nation {{!}} The Star Online|website=www.thestar.com.my|access-date=2018-11-15}} In the same year the company also started the Yu Cai Education Foundation with a grant of $6.6 million to help ethnic Chinese groups.{{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/global/2010/0315/philanthropy-technology-telecom-malaysia-billionaire-ananda-krishnan.html#410807fd77c5|title=Malaysia's Telecom Billionaire Gives Back|last=Mertens|first=Brian|work=Forbes|access-date=2018-11-15|language=en}} In 2006 Ananda Krishnan's media company Astro introduced its scholarship program, promising to devote an annual RM2 million to support promising Malaysian undergraduate and graduate students studying media and broadcasting.{{Cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com.my/news/community/2006/11/30/astro-support-for-ad-industry-hailed/|title=Astro support for ad industry hailed - Community {{!}} The Star Online|website=www.thestar.com.my|access-date=2018-11-15}} In 2008 he contributed to the opening of the Montfort Girls Centre to help orphaned and underprivileged girls develop their vocational skills. {{Cite news|url=https://www.forbes.com/global/2010/0315/philanthropy-technology-telecom-malaysia-billionaire-ananda-krishnan.html#fe1863b77c50|title=Malaysia's Telecom Billionaire Gives Back|last=Mertens|first=Brian|work=Forbes|access-date=2018-11-26|language=en}} == See also == * [[List of Tamil businesspeople]] == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * [https://web.archive.org/web/20120615072504/http://www.theedgemalaysia.com/in-the-financial-daily/192103-usaha-tegas-group-impacting-lives.html "Usaha Tegas Group: Impacting lives"] *[https://www.forbes.com/lists/2010/10/billionaires-2010_Ananda-Krishnan_YK1N.html Forbes List of Billionaires] * [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/markets/2790027/Malaysian-billionaire-Ananda-Krishnan-bails-out-Johnston-Press.html Malaysian billionaire Ananda Krishnan bails out Johnston Press] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20080906162145/http://www.pr-inside.com/malaysia-and-singapore-asian-nations-of-r700593.htm Malaysia and Singapore: Asian Nations of Economic Success by Globalization] * [http://business.timesonline.co.uk/tol/business/industry_sectors/leisure/article3867841.ece Malaysian Tycoon Ananda Krishnan reaps £120m from sale of Excel] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20080919054657/http://sub.adoimagazine.com/blog/index.php/tag/ananda-krishnan/ WHEN TWO MEDIA TITANS CLASH] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20081121051414/http://www.networkmalaysia.com/subtitle/article_anandak.htm Ananda Krishnan] * [http://www.indianmalaysian.com/indian_06-06_anandakrishnan.html T. Ananda Krishnan] * [http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2011-06-19/news/29676883_1_tak-t-ananda-krishnan-robert-kuok What is it about billionaire T Ananda Krishnan that India has so much interest], An article on India's [[The Economic Times]] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Krishnan, Ananda}} [[Category:1938 births]] [[Category:Harvard Business School alumni]] [[Category:Malaysian Buddhists]] [[Category:Malaysian businesspeople]] [[Category:Malaysian chairmen of corporations]] [[Category:Malaysian people of Sri Lankan Tamil descent]] [[Category:Tamil businesspeople]] [[Category:American businessmen of Indian descent]] [[Category:University of Melbourne alumni]] [[Category:People educated at Trinity College (University of Melbourne)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Sri Lankan Tamil businesspeople]] [[Category:Malaysian billionaires]] [[Category:Tamil billionaires]] [[Category:Malaysian people of Indian descent]]

[[Universiti Teknologi Malaysia]] | website =[http://www.annuarmusa.com www.annuarmusa.com] | footnotes = {{pom|3547}} }} [[Malay titles#Tan Sri|Tan Sri]] [[Malay titles#Datuk Sri|Datuk Seri Panglima]] [[Hajji|Haji]] '''Annuar Musa''' ([[Jawi alphabet|Jawi]]: اننوار بن موسى; born 18 May 1956) is a [[Malaysian people|Malaysian]] politician and the Member of the [[Dewan Rakyat|Parliament of Malaysia]] for the [[Ketereh (federal constituency)|Ketereh]] constituency. Annuar is the former minister of [[Rural Development]], now known as the Ministry of Rural and Regional Development, has been a division head in [[United Malays National Organisation]] (UMNO) for 20 years in addition to serving over 14 years as a member of the supreme council (MT) and as a minister for almost 10 years. He was the President of [[Kelantan FA]] (Kafa) from 2009 until his resignation on 8 November 2016 but stay as its adviser.{{cite news |title=Annuar quits as Kafa president |url=http://www.themalaymailonline.com/sports/article/annuar-quits-as-kafa-president |last1= |first1= |work=Bernama |date=8 November 2016 |publisher= The Malay Mail Online |accessdate=4 February 2017}} In 2018, he was nominated for the new FAM presidency role by [[Kuala Lumpur FA]], reported in a [[Fox Sports Asia]] [http://www.foxsportsasia.com/football/880810/annuar-musa-set-contest-fam-presidency-three-way-battle/ article]. However he withdraw from the presidency race again.{{cite news |title=Annuar Musa pulls out of race for FAM presidency|url=https://www.malaysiakini.com/news/431796|last1= |first1= |work=[[Bernama]] |date=29 June 2018 |publisher= [[Malaysiakini]] |accessdate=13 August 2018}} ==Personal life== Annuar is married to Puan Sri Rosniah Abdul Rahman and has four children, Azzahraa, Azzwaa, Ajjrina and Afiq Amani. ===Education=== Annuar is a proud alumni of [[Royal Military College (Malaysia)|Royal Military College]] (RMC), Sungai Besi. Annuar has a master's degree in Construction Management from the [[University College of London]]. Prior to that he earned bachelor's Town and Country Planning from [[Universiti Teknologi Malaysia]] (UTM). ===Political career=== In addition to active politics, Annuar also a member of Malaysian Institute of Planners. He also served as Assistant Director of Town Planning, City Hall and Director, Corporate Planning Division, the State Economic Development Corporation. Although he has been politically active in Kelantan UMNO since 1979, but only significantly when he was selected first contested the [[Kelantan State Legislative Assembly]] (DUN) Peringat constituency in [[Malaysian state elections, 1986|1986]] general election and defeated the candidate from the [[Pan-Malaysian Islamic Party]] (PAS), Daud bin Jusoh with a majority of 136 votes.{{citation needed|date=January 2016}} However, in the election of [[Malaysian general election, 1990|1990]] he lost to opposition candidate, [[Mohamad Sabu]] from PAS in Parliament stage. The defeat, however, redeemed in [[Malaysian general election, 1995|1995]] general election when he won in the same Parliament seat, but defeated candidate from [[Parti Melayu Semangat 46]] (S46), Rafei Mat Salleh. Annuar but again lost in the parliamentary phase of the [[Malaysian general election, 1999|1999]] general election, but this time the candidate of [[Parti Keadilan Rakyat]] (PKR), Mohamed Mustafa.{{citation needed|date=January 2016}} He switched to contest the state seat again in [[Malaysian general election, 2004|2004]] general election and won the Kok Lanas state seat by beating Md. Ashari Mamat from PAS. He return to contest the Ketereh federal constituency in [[Malaysian general election, 2008|2008]] general election but lost to PKR candidate, Abdul Aziz Kadir. However he contested the same constituency in [[Malaysian general election, 2013|2013]] general election and managed to win it back from the same PKR candidate. Annuar managed to retain the Ketereh seat again in [[Malaysian general election, 2018|2018]] general election. In addition of contesting general elections experience, Annuar also has extensive experience in the party, including a member of the MT from 1991 to present. He also served as Chairman of the Kelantan Barisan Nasional (1994-2001) and Deputy Chairman of the State Umno Liaison Body (1991-2003). On the part he was the chief of the new Ketereh previously known as Nilam Puri and phase from 1986 to present. ==Controversy== On 3 May 2012, Tan Sri Annuar Musa was suspended from taking part in any football activities in Kelantan where he is the President. The [[Football Association of Malaysia]] (FAM) disciplinary committee found Annuar's negative statement against the national football team on 12 Feb had breached the status of FAM's Article 88 (2010-2014). FAM's Article 88 states that only the president and the secretary-general can comment on the national team's performance.[http://www.bolasepakmalaysia.com/p/annuar-musa-digantung-fam-selama-30-bulan/ Annuar Musa Digantung FAM Selama 30 Bulan] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140808172402/http://www.bolasepakmalaysia.com/p/annuar-musa-digantung-fam-selama-30-bulan/ |date=8 August 2014 }} In 2016, Annuar's decision to quit as Kafa president during Kelantan football team, [[Kelantan FA|The Red Warriors]] (TRW) was going through bad performances and the financial problem of settling outstanding footballers and even coach salaries was questioned by many who had likened him to [[The captain goes down with the ship|"the captain abandoning his sinking ship"]].{{cite news |title=No turning back |url=https://www.pressreader.com/malaysia/new-straits-times/20161119/282518658090128 |last1=SINGH |first1= DEVINDER |work=[[New Straits Times]] |date=19 November 2016 |publisher= New Straits Times Press (M) Berhad |accessdate=14 February 2017}}{{cite news |title=K’tan to pay outstanding salaries for footballers in stages, says Annuar |url=http://www.malaysiakini.com/news/327028|last1= |first1= |work=Bernama |date=15 January 2016 |publisher= [[Malaysiakini]] |accessdate=14 May 2017}}{{cite news |title=(Football) PFAM blasts former Kafa president over accusation of interference|url=https://www.nst.com.my/news/2016/12/200821/football-pfam-blasts-former-kafa-president-over-accusation-interference |last1=SINGH |first1= AJITPAL |work=[[New Straits Times]] |date=31 December 2016 |publisher= New Straits Times Press (M) Berhad |accessdate=14 February 2017}}{{cite news |title=JDT take a jab at KAFA over Jonny McKain’s unpaid salary |url=https://www.fourthofficial.com/2017/43607/jdt-take-jab-kafa-jonny-mckains-unpaid-salary/ |last1=Krishnan |first1= Gowri |work=FourthOfficial |date=24 February 2017 |publisher= FourthOfficial |accessdate=14 February 2017}}{{cite news |title=Annuar Musa and KAFA, it’s time to own up to your own mistakes! |url=https://www.fourthofficial.com/2017/46111/annuar-musa-kafa-time-mistakes/ |last1= |first1= |author= Keeshaanan Sundaresan |work=FourthOfficial |date=6 May 2017 |publisher= FourthOfficial |accessdate=16 May 2017}} Annuar embroiled himself in a rocky conflict and contentious relationship with the Crown Prince of Johor [[Tunku Ismail Sultan Ibrahim]], another potential FAM presidency candidate; in the run-up to the FAM election in 2017.{{cite news |title=TMJ vs. Annuar Musa for FAM boss revives Johor-Kelantan rivalry |url=http://www.espnfc.com/blog/football-asia/153/post/3087451/tmj-vs-annuar-musa-for-fam-president-revives-johor-kelantan-rivalry |last1=DARBY |first1=STEVE |work=STEVE DARBY|date=22 March 2017 |publisher= [[ESPN]] |accessdate=16 May 2017}} Tunku Ismail has alleged that a certain "Tan Sri", apparently was referring to Annuar, who is [[Majlis Amanah Rakyat]] (MARA) chairman had forced its entities to sponsor Kafa. In a [[Facebook]] post on 12 January 2017, Tunku Ismail has revealed photographs of documents showing sponsorship to Kafa; a RM500,000 by [[Universiti Kuala Lumpur]] (UniKL) and an additional RM200,000 by [[Majlis Amanah Rakyat#Subsidiaries|Mara Investment Berhad]] (PMB); both subsidiaries of MARA.{{cite news |title=TMJ: 'Tan Sri' should explain MARA sponsorship for Kelantan |url=http://www.thesundaily.my/news/2126700 |last1= |first1= |author=G. Surach |work=[[The Sun Daily]] |date=12 January 2017 |publisher= [[The Sun Daily]] |accessdate=16 May 2017}} On 31 January 2017, MARA announced Annuar has been suspended and asked to go on leave as MARA chairman and PMB head pending an internal investigation and audit is conducted into allegations made against him.{{cite news |title=Dr Yusof: Mara to probe allegations against Annuar Musa |url=http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017/01/31/annuar-musa-go-on-leave-probe-into-kafa-sponsorship/ |last1= |first1= |work= The Star |date=31 January 2017 |publisher= [[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]] |accessdate=16 May 2017}}{{cite news |title=Annuar Musa suspended as Mara chairman |url=http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017/01/31/annuar-musa-suspended-as-mara-chairman/ |last1= |first1= |author=RAHMAH GHAZALI |work= The Star |date=31 January 2017 |publisher= [[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]] |accessdate=16 May 2017}} Suspended Annuar also was quizzed by the [[Malaysian Anti-Corruption Commission]] (MACC) for four hours on 3 February 2017.{{cite news |title=MACC questions Annuar Musa for four hours |url=http://www.thestar.com.my/news/nation/2017/02/03/macc-questions-annuar-musa-for-four-hours/ |last1=KAOS |first1= JOSEPH |work= The Star |date=3 February 2017 |publisher= [[The Star (Malaysia)|The |url=http://www.themalaymailonline.com/malaysia/article/macc-interviews-annuar-musa-over-alleged-abuse-at-mara |last1= |first1= |work=The Malay Mail |date=3 February 2017 |publisher= [[The Malay Mail]] |accessdate=16 May 2017}} Annuar pulled out from the 2017 FAM presidency election lastly citing the reason to focus on his political obligation.{{cite news |title=Tunku Ismail new FAM president, Annuar drops out |url=http://www.freemalaysiatoday.com/category/nation/2017/03/23/tunku-ismail-new-fam-president-annuar-drops-out/ |last1= |first1= |work= FMT |date=23 March 2017 |publisher= [[Free Malaysia Today]] |accessdate=16 May 2017}} He also did not renew his MARA chairman contract ended on 11 August 2017 amid still under suspension.{{cite news |title=PM to get list of Mara chairman candidates soon |url=http://www.themalaysianinsight.com/s/10549/ |last1= |first1= |work= [[Bernama]] |date=12 August 2017 |publisher= The Malaysian Insight |accessdate=12 August 2017}} Eventually MACC too decided not to press charges against him due to the allegations insufficient evidence.{{cite news |title=MACC drops case against Annuar Musa over alleged abuse of UniKL funds|url=https://www.malaymail.com/s/1531493/macc-drops-case-against-annuar-musa-over-alleged-abuse-of-unikl-funds|last1= |first1= |work=The Malay Mail |date=13 December 2017 |publisher= [[The Malay {{Infobox organization | caption = CCBC Logo since 2012 | logo = [[File:Canada China Business Council Logo.png|300px|alt=Canada China Business Council Logo]] | services = Government advocacy, event organization, trade missions, research, publishing | key_people = '''Peter Kruyt''', Chair
'''Graham Shantz''', President '''Sarah Kutulakos''', Executive Director | name = Canada China Business Council | founded_date = 1978 | location = [[Toronto|Toronto, Ontario]], [[Canada]] | area_served = Global | focus = [[International Trade]] | num_employees = 17 | homepage = http://www.ccbc.com/ }} The '''Canada China Business Council''' or CCBC (French: ''Conseil d'affaires Canada-Chine'', Chinese: ''加中贸易理事会'') is a private, [[non-profit]] business association founded in 1978 to facilitate and promote business, trade and investment between Canada and [[People's Republic of China]]. CCBC has offices in [[Toronto]], [[Vancouver]], [[Montreal]], [[Calgary]], [[Beijing]], and [[Shanghai]]. CCBC is the de facto Canadian chamber of commerce in Beijing. It also has business incubators<ref>{{cite web|title=Business Incubation Platform|url=http://www.ccbc.com/membership/bic/|website=Canada China Business Council|publisher=CCBC|accessdate=23 Jun 2014}}</ref> in Beijing, Shanghai, Montreal, and Calgary to help Canadian companies grow in China, and Chinese investors to succeed in Canada.<ref name="Main">{{cite web|last=|first=|date=|title=Main|url=http://www.ccbc.com/about/|work=|publisher= Canada China Business Council|accessdate=20 Jun 2014}}</ref>
==Mandate== *Stimulate growth in bilateral business, trade and investment in goods and services; *Promote closer bilateral relations between Canada and China; *Provide practical and focused business advice and services to members; *Be the voice of the Canadian business community on matters pertaining Canada-China relations at all levels of government and to the general public in both countries.<ref>{{cite web|title=Council Overview|url=http://www.ccbc.com/about/council-overview/|website=Canada China Business Council|publisher=CCBC|accessdate=26 Jun 2014}}</ref>
==Events==
CCBC hosts various events such as trade missions and delegations, conferences, roundtables and seminars throughout the year. It also organizes business and networking events on behalf of its members. Notable past events include the state visit to China by Governor General [[David Johnston]] in 2013,<ref>{{cite web|last1=Bélanger|first1=Marie-Pierre|title=Governor General to Undertake a State Visit to China|url=http://www.gg.ca/document.aspx?id=15348|website=The Governor General of Canada|publisher=www.gg.ca|accessdate=23 Jun 2014}}</ref> visit by [[Prime Minister Stephen Harper]]<ref>{{cite web|last1=Walker|first1=Sandy|title=Bridge to China: PM Harper's Visit to China to Facilitate Canada-China Investment and Trade|url=http://www.securitiesmininglaw.com/bridge-to-china-pm-harper-visit-to-china-to-facilitate-canada-china-investment-and-trade|publisher=Securities Mining Law}}</ref> in 2012, and China's Commerce Minister CHEN Deming's<ref>{{cite web|title=Chen Deming: Enhance China-Canada Trade and Economic Cooperation for a Better and Faster Common Development|url=http://english.mofcom.gov.cn/aarticle/newsrelease/significantnews/201209/20120908366420.html|website=MINISTRY OF COMMERCE PEOPLE'S REPUBLIC OF CHINA|publisher=MINISTRY OF COMMERCE, MOFCOM|accessdate=23 Jun 2014}}</ref> visit to Canada in 2012. Other events include:
*CCBC Annual General Meeting and Policy Conference *Canada-China Business Forum *CCBC China Business Workshops *CCBC Great Canadian Christmas Party *CCBC Canadian Charity Ball *Canada Day celebrations
==Publications==
CCBC publishes its annual magazine, the ''Canada-China Business Forum Magazine".<ref>{{cite web|title=Canada China Business Forum|url=http://www.ccbc.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/Canada-China-Business-Forum-Magazine-20131.pdf|website=Canada China Business Council|publisher=Canada China Business Council|accessdate=23 Jun 2014}}</ref> The magazine covers topics relevant to Canada-China business, trade and investment. Business leaders, public officials and academics familiar with Canada-China relations contribute to the magazine. The most recent edition was published in August 2016.''
==Advocacy and awards==
CCBC advocates for stronger bilateral ties between Canada and China and for a better business environment in each country. This advocacy work is directed by members towards governments and institutions in both countries. The Government of Alberta signed an externship agreement with the CCBC in 2012 to allow young Albertans to gain valuable work experience in China.<ref>{{cite web|last=|first=|date=|title=International and Intergovernmental Relations Annual Report 2012–2013|url=http://www.international.alberta.ca/documents/IIRAnnualReport_2012-2013.pdf|work=|publisher=Province of Alberta|accessdate=27 Jun 2014}}</ref> CCBC also recognizes companies that have demonstrated business excellence and leadership in China and Canada. In 2012, the CCBC presented its biennial China-Canada Business Excellence Awards to:
*[[Hatch Ltd|Hatch]] for CCBC Member of the Year <ref>{{cite web|title=Hatch wins Canada China Business Council Gold Medal as 2012 Member of the Year|url=http://www.hatch.ca/News_Publications/News/2012/Hatch_wins_Canada_China_Business_Council_Gold_Medal_as_2012_Member_of_the_Year.html|website=Hatch|publisher=Hatch Ltd.|accessdate=23 Jun 2014}}</ref> *Epic Data International for Outstanding SME<ref>{{cite web|title=Epic Data Receives CCBC Award for China Strategy|url=http://www.epicdata.com/press/epic-data-receives-ccbc-award-for-china-strategy/|website=Epic Data|publisher=Epic Data, a division of Sylogist Ltd.|accessdate=23 Jun 2014}}</ref> *[[Huawei]] for Investment in Canada <ref>{{cite web|title=Huawei Canada Wins Gold at the Business Excellence Awards Recognized by Canada China Business Council for Continued Investment in Canada|url=http://www.huawei.com/ca-en/about-huawei/newsroom/press-release/hw-197864.htm|website=Huawei Canada|publisher=Huawei Technologies Co., Ltd|accessdate=23 Jun 2014}}</ref> *[[Ivey Business School]] for Education Excellence<ref>{{cite web|last1=Langrish|first1=Ivan|title=Ivey Takes Home Gold: Canada's Premier Business School Earns Prestigious Education Excellence Award|url=http://www.ivey.uwo.ca/media/releases/2012/121130.htm|website=Ivey|publisher=Ivey Business School|accessdate=23 Jun 2014}}</ref>
==Structure== The CCBC is a private, non-partisan, membership-based business association, with members from both Canada and China. Members include large multinational corporations such as [[Barrick Gold]], [[BlackBerry]], [[Bombardier Inc.|Bombardier]], [[BMO Financial Group]], Caisse de Depot, [[CITIC]], [[Export Development Canada]], [[Huawei Technologies]], [[Manulife Financial]], [[Molycorp]], [[Power Corporation]], [[SNC Lavalin]], and [[Sun Life Financial]]. The CCBC draws its members from different industries, including manufacturing, oil and gas, education, public sector and professional services. The CCBC works closely with the [[China Council for Promotion of International Trade]](CCPIT).<ref>{{cite web|title=Membership|url=http://www.ccbc.com/membership/|website=Canada China Business Council|publisher=Canada China Business Council|accessdate=23 Jun 2014}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}
[[Category:Business organizations based in Canada]] [[Category:Canada–China relations]]

{{Tone|article|date=August 2017}} '''Category design''' is a [[business strategy]] and discipline that helps companies create, develop, and dominate new categories of products and services.
Category design extends beyond a [[Leadership|leadership team's]] narrower focus on products, [[Organizational culture|company culture]] and [[business model]]s. Taught in academia as a [[Business Strategy|business]] and [[Marketing strategy|market strategy]],<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://ecorner.stanford.edu/videos/4231/The-Journey-of-Category-Design|title=Dave Peterson: The Journey of Category Design {{!}} Stanford eCorner|website=ecorner.stanford.edu|access-date=2017-07-16}}</ref><ref name=":2">{{Cite news|url=https://www.heavybit.com/library/video/go-to-market-and-category-design-fundamentals/|title=Jennifer Johnson {{!}} Go-To-Market And Category Design Fundamentals {{!}} Heavybit|date=2017-03-29|work=Heavybit|access-date=2017-07-16|language=en-US}}</ref> it is explicitly deployed by [[disruptive innovation]] companies like [[Uber (company)|Uber]], [[Airbnb]] and other start up brands.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/246784|title=5 Essentials for Creating a New Market Category|last=Snyder|first=Michelle|date=2015-06-17|work=Entrepreneur|access-date=2017-07-25|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.brandingstrategyinsider.com/2015/10/creating-category-of-one-brands.html#.WXcN_YiGPIU|title=Creating Category Of One Brands {{!}} Branding Strategy Insider|date=2015-10-30|work=Branding Strategy Insider|access-date=2017-07-25|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.brandingstrategyinsider.com/2014/01/7-strategies-to-create-new-business-categories.html|title=7 Strategies To Create New Business Categories|date=2014-01-17|website=Branding Strategy Insider|access-date=2017-07-25}}</ref> Business magazines such as ''[[Harvard Business Review]]'' and ''[[Inc. (magazine)|Inc.]]'' have published articles on the value of category design.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://hbr.org/2013/03/why-it-pays-to-be-a-category-creator|title=Why It Pays to Be a Category Creator|work=Harvard Business Review|access-date=2017-07-25}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.inc.com/aj-agrawal/how-to-create-a-new-category-for-your-product.html|title=How to Create a New Category for Your Product|last=|first=|date=Dec 2014|work=Inc.com|access-date=2017-07-25|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://hbr.org/2011/09/why-category-creation-is-the-u|title=Category Creation Is the Ultimate Growth Strategy|work=Harvard Business Review|access-date=2017-07-25}}</ref> [[Marc Benioff]] is an aficionado.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://legendsandlosers.podbean.com/e/entrepreneur-roundtable-how-to-design-dominate-your-category-wrhonda-smith-part-2/|title=022: Entrepreneur Roundtable: How to Design & Dominate Your Category w/Rhonda Smith - Part 2|last=Development|first=PodBean|access-date=2017-07-25|language=en}}</ref>
== History == Category design is
* discovering and defining a category problem, * creating a clear story (called a [[Point of view (philosophy)|point-of-view]]) that explains and sells the category idea, * defining a category blueprint, * driving the category strategy across a company's [[Stakeholder (corporate)|stakeholders]] (mobilization), * shaping customers' thinking (lightning strikes).<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.inc.com/play-bigger/the-key-to-designing-your-company-success-category-king.html|title=How to Design a Business That Dominates Its Niche|last=|first=|date=13 Jun 2016|work=Inc.com|access-date=2017-07-16|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en}}</ref> The concepts tie back into recent writings about how our brains work, particularly [[cognitive bias]]es as described by [[Daniel Kahneman]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/first-came-behavioural-economics-now-its-time-liz-griffith|title=First came behavioural economics – Now it's time for behavioural marketing|last=Griffith|first=Liz|date=2017-04-19|work=Linkedin Pulse|access-date=2017-06-27|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en}}</ref> Good category takes advantage of cognitive biases such as the choice supportive bias and [[groupthink]] bias.
After the book was published in June 2016, [[Mike Maples]], a founding partner of [[Floodgate Fund|Floodgate]], published articles supporting the concept.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://techcrunch.com/2016/10/10/floodgates-mike-maples-on-what-makes-category-kings/|title=Floodgate's Mike Maples on what makes category kings {{!}} TechCrunch|last=Stebbings|first=Harry|access-date=2017-06-27}}</ref>
=== The 6–10 law ===
Data research shows that "category kings" (companies that dominates a market category)<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://techcrunch.com/2017/02/05/keys-to-ascending-the-consumer-internet-throne/|title=Keys to ascending the consumer-internet throne {{!}} TechCrunch|last=Lee|first=Roger|last2=Lu|first2=Jeff|access-date=2017-06-27|last3=Ravichandran|first3=Deepak}}</ref> that go public when they are between six and ten years old create most of the value among all VC-funded tech companies. Companies that go public sooner than six years old often lose value; companies that [[Initial public offering|IPO]] after ten years old create little value for [[shareholder]]s. The reason is thought to be that categories take around six years to develop, and most of a category's growth happens in that six to ten year timeframe. After ten years, a category is established and growth slows, so [[share price]]s level off.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://sandhill.com/article/the-6-10-law-data-science-reveals-how-age-and-money-impact-startup-value-creation/|title=The 6–10 Law: Data Science Reveals How Age and Money Impact Startup Value Creation {{!}} Sandhill|website=sandhill.com|language=en|access-date=2017-06-27}}</ref><ref name=":1" /> This was discussed in a ''[[Harvard Business Review]]'' article titled "How Unicorns Grow".<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://harvardpolitics.com/online/unicorns-mythological-creatures/|title=Unicorns and Other Mythological Creatures|website=harvardpolitics.com|language=en|access-date=2017-06-27}}</ref>
==See also== * [[Cornering the market]] * [[New business development]] * [[Value chain]] * [[Value network]] * [[Value shop]]

[[Cessna Citation Hemisphere|Citation Hemisphere]] }} |} The '''Cessna Citation family''' is [[Cessna]]'s [[business jet]]s line. The 7,000th Citation was delivered on June 27, 2016, forming the largest business jet fleet: the first Citation was put into service in 1972 and more than 35 million flight hours have been logged since.{{cite press release |url= http://txtav.com/en/newsroom/2016/06/cessna-delivers-milestone-7000th-citation-as-netjets-first-citation-latitude |title= Cessna delivers milestone 7,000th Citation as NetJets’ first Citation Latitude |date= June 27, 2016 |publisher= [[Textron Aviation]]}} It started with the small [[Cessna Citation I|Citation I]] prototype flying on September 15, 1969 and produced until 1985, developed into the 1978-2006 [[Cessna Citation II|Citation II]]/Bravo, the 1989-2011 [[Cessna Citation V|Citation V]]/Ultra/Encore and the [[Cessna CitationJet|CitationJet]] since 1993. The standup [[Cessna Citation III|Citation III]]/VI/VII was delivered from 1983 to 2000, its fuselage was reused in the [[Cessna Citation X|Citation X]]/X+ delivered from 1996 to 2018, the [[Citation Excel|Excel]] since 1998 and the [[Citation Sovereign|Sovereign]] since 2004. The [[Citation Mustang|Mustang]] was a [[Very Light Jet]] delivered from 2006 to 2017 while the flat floor fuselage [[Citation Latitude|Latitude]] is delivered since 2015 and the larger [[Citation Longitude|Longitude]] from 2018. ==Lineage== {|class="navbox collapsible" !colspan=66 class="navbox-title"|{{navbar-collapsible| Citation deliveries timeline }} |- style="background-color:WhiteSmoke;" style="background-color:Lavender" | [[Cessna Citation Hemisphere|Hemisphere]] |- style="font-weight:bold" |colspan=10|   = Citation I cross section |colspan=10|   = Citation III cross section |colspan=10|   = Latitude cross section |} ==Models== ===Citation I=== [[File:CN Air Cessna 501 Citation I SP (cropped).jpg|thumb|Model 500 Citation I]] The small '''[[Cessna Citation I|Citation I]]''' (500) was announced in October 1968, its ''Fanjet 500'' prototype first flew on September 15, 1969 and it was certified as the ''Citation'' on September 9, 1971. It was upgraded in 1976 as the ''Citation I'' and a single pilot variant, production ended in 1985 after 689 deliveries. Powered by [[JT15D]] turbofans, the [[straight wing]] aircraft was developed into the [[Cessna Citation II|Citation II]]/Bravo. ===Citation II/Bravo=== [[File:LUCAS OIL PRODUCTS INC DBA CROSS TIMBERS, MO - 2000 CESSNA 550 N48FW (550-0948) (5137861075) (cropped).jpg|thumb|model 550 Citation II]] The '''[[Cessna Citation II|Citation II]]''', a stretched [[Citation I]], was announced in September 1976, first flew on January 31, 1977 and was certified in March 1978. The ''II/SP'' is a single pilot version, the improved ''S/II'' first flew on February 14, 1984 and the ''Citation Bravo'' upgraded with new avionics and [[Pratt & Whitney Canada PW500|P&WC PW530]]A turbofans on April 25, 1995, while the [[United States]] used it as the ''T-47''. Production ceased in 2006 after {{#expr:688+336+160}} were delivered. === Citation III/VI/VII === [[File:Cessna 650 Citation III, Wheels Aviation AN1469360 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Model 650 Citation III]] The {{cvt|2350|nmi|km}} range '''[[Citation III]]''' (Model 650) was announced at the October 1976 [[National Business Aviation Association|NBAA]] convention, it made its [[maiden flight]] on May 30, 1979, received its [[type certification]] on April 30, 1982 and was delivered between 1983 and 1992. The cheaper '''Citation VI''' was produced from 1991 to 1995 and the more powerful '''Citation VII''' was offered between 1992 and 2000, 360 of all variants were delivered. An all new design, it had a 312 sq ft (29 m²) [[swept wing]] for a 22,000 lb (10 t) MTOW, a [[T-tail]] and two {{cvt|3650-4080|lbf|kN}} [[TFE731]] turbofans. Its fuselage cross section and cockpit were kept in the later [[Citation X]], [[Citation Excel]] and [[Citation Sovereign]]. ===Citation V/Ultra/Encore=== [[File:N217TH 1996 CESSNA 560 560-0390 (5045025416) (cropped).jpg|thumb|Model 560 Citation V]] Stretched from the [[Cessna Citation II|Citation II]], the '''[[Cessna Citation V|Citation V]]''' (Model 560) prototype flew in August 1987, it was certified on December 9, 1988 and delivered from April 1987, {{#expr:262+279+168+65}} were delivered until 2011. The upgraded ''Citation Ultra'' was announced in September 1993, the ''Citation Encore'' upgraded with [[Pratt & Whitney Canada PW500|PW535]] turbofans was announced in 1998, before the improved ''Encore+''. Its US Military designation is ''UC-35''. ===CitationJet=== [[File:OO-FLN (cropped).JPG|thumb|Model 525A CitationJet CJ2]] The '''[[Cessna CitationJet]]''' was launched in October 1989, its first flight was on April 29, 1991, FAA certification was awarded on October 16, 1992, first delivery happened on March 30, 1993, and by June 2017, 2,000 of all variants have been delivered. Powered by two {{cvt|1900|lbf|kN}} [[Williams FJ44]]s, it uses the [[Cessna Citation II|Citation II]]'s forward fuselage with a new carry-through section, straight wing, and [[T-tail]]. The basic model was updated with the '''CJ/CJ1/M2''' (525) names, it was stretched in the '''CJ2/CJ2+''' (525A) delivered since 2000, then further in the '''CJ3/CJ3+''' (525B) delivered from December 2004 and finally in the '''CJ4''' (525C) delivered since 2010. The '''[[Cessna 526 CitationJet]]''' is a twin-seat tandem military trainer developed from the CitationJet for the [[Joint Primary Aircraft Training System|JPATS]] competition.{{cite book |last=Taylor |first= Michael J. H.|authorlink= |coauthors= |title= Brassey's World Aircraft & Systems Directory|year=1996 |publisher= Brassey's |location=London |isbn=1-85753-198-1|page=128}} ===Citation X/X+=== [[File:N975QS 2002 Cessna 750 C-N 750-0175 Citation X (7039507775) (cropped).jpg|thumb|Model 750 Citation X]] The '''[[Citation X]]{{efn|''X'' as in the Roman numeral for ''ten''}}''' (Model 750) was announced at the October 1990 [[National Business Aviation Association|NBAA]] convention, it made its [[maiden flight]] on December 21, 1993, received its [[type certification]] on June 3, 1996 and was first delivered in July 1996. The updated '''Citation X+''' was offered from 2012 with a {{cvt|14|inch}} cabin stretch and upgraded systems. Keeping the [[Cessna Citation III|Citation III]] fuselage cross section, it has a new 37° [[swept wing]] with an area of 527 ft² (49 m²) for a fast Mach 0.935 [[V Speeds|MMo]] and a 36,600 lb (16.6 t) MTOW, a T-tail and two 7,034 lbf (31.29 kN) [[AE3007]] turbofans for 3,460 nmi (6,408 km) of range. After 338 deliveries, production should end in 2018. ===Excel/XLS/XLS+=== [[File:Cessna 560XL Citation XLS (cropped).jpg|thumb|right|Model 560XL Citation Excel]] The {{cvt|2,100|nmi|km}} [[Citation Excel]] (Model 560XL) was announced in October 1994, it first flew on February 29, 1996, certification was granted in April 1998 and over 900 have been delivered. The 20,200 lb (9,200 kg) MTOW jet is powered by two {{cvt|3650-4080|lbf|kN}} [[Pratt & Whitney Canada PW500|PW500]] turbofans, has the [[Citation V]] (560) [[cruciform tail]] and unswept [[supercritical wing]] of 370 sq ft (34 m²), and the [[Citation X]] stand-up cabin slightly shortened. The '''XLS''' 2004 update has upgraded engines and a [[glass cockpit]] and the 2008 '''XLS+''' has [[FADEC]] and a revised nose. ===Sovereign=== [[File:Cessna Citation Sovereign Rafael Luiz (14725958464) (cropped).jpg|thumb|Model 680 Citation Sovereign]] The {{cvt|3,200|nmi|km}} range '''[[Citation Sovereign]]''' (Model 680) was announced at the 1998 [[National Business Aviation Association|NBAA]] convention, it made its [[maiden flight]] in February [[2002 in aviation|2002]], certification was awarded on June 2, 2004, and deliveries began in late September. The improved '''Sovereign+''' was announced at the October 2012 NBAA for a first flight in April 2012 and deliveries in December, with [[winglets]], improved engines and flight deck. The [[Citation Excel]] fuselage was stretched and joined with a large, clean-sheet 16.3 °, {{cvt|516|sqft}} wing and two {{cvt|5,900|lbf|kN}} [[PW300]] engines for a {{cvt|30,800|lb}} [[max takeoff weight|MTOW]]. ===Mustang=== [[File:Cessna 510 Citation Mustang AN1613988 (cropped).jpg|thumb|Model 510 Citation Mustang]] The '''[[Cessna Citation Mustang]]''' (Model 510) is a [[very light jet]] launched at the 2002 [[National Business Aviation Association|NBAA]] convention, it first flew on 23 April 2005. It received its FAA [[type certification]] September 8, 2006, was first delivered on November 22 and production ended in 2017 after 479 aircraft were built. The {{cvt|8645|lb}} [[MTOW]] jet is powered by two {{cvt|1460|lbf|kN}} [[Pratt & Whitney Canada PW615F|P&WC PW615F]] [[turbofan]]s, can reach {{cvt|340|knots|km/h}} and can cover {{cvt|1,167|nmi|km}}. ===Columbus=== The '''[[Cessna Citation Columbus|Citation Columbus]]''' (Model 850) was a 4000 nmi range business jet project launched in February 2008 and cancelled in July 2009, topping the Citation family. Powered by 8,830 lbf (39.3 kN) [[Pratt & Whitney Canada PW800|PW810]] turbofans, the $27 million aircraft had a 709 sq ft (66 m²), 30° swept airfoil. ===Latitude=== [[File:Air Charter Scotland, G-SHUI, Cessna 680A Citation Latitude (44389250211) (cropped).jpg|thumb|Model 680A Citation Latitude]] The {{cvt|2700|nmi|km}} range '''[[Cessna Citation Latitude|Citation Latitude]]''' (Model 680A) was announced at the 2011 [[National Business Aviation Association|NBAA]] convention, the prototype first flew on 18 February 2014, it achieved FAA certification on June 5, 2015 and first deliveries begun on August 27. It keeps the [[Cessna Citation Sovereign|Model 680 Sovereign]] wing, twin [[Pratt & Whitney Canada PW300|P&WC PW306D]] turbofans and [[cruciform tail]], but its clean sheet stand-up circular [[fuselage]] has a flat floor. This new fuselage is kept in the later [[Cessna Citation Longitude]]. ===Longitude=== [[File:EBACE 2018, Le Grand-Saconnex (BL7C0443) (longitude) (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Model 700 Longitude mockup]] The {{cvt|3,500|nmi|km}} range '''[[Cessna Citation Longitude|Citation Longitude]]''' (Model 700) was announced at the May 2012 [[EBACE]], it made its first flight on October 8, 2016, certification is expected in the third quarter of 2018 with deliveries later in the same year. Powered by [[Honeywell HTF7000]] turbofans, The aluminum [[airframe]] has the fuselage cross-section of the [[Cessna Citation Latitude|Citation Latitude]], stretched by a seat row, with a new ~28° [[swept wing]] and a [[T-tail]]. ===Hemisphere=== [[File:EBACE 2018, Le Grand-Saconnex (BL7C0443) (hemisphere) (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Citation Hemisphere Model]] The '''[[Cessna Citation Hemisphere|Citation Hemisphere]]''' is a {{convert|4500|nmi|km}} range, Mach 0.9 business jet project. Announced in November 2015, it was then expected to fly in 2019 but its development was suspended in April 2018 to wait for its [[Safran Silvercrest]] engines to be perfected. == Current Models == {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Model ! Length !! Span !! Area ! Sweep !! Inside !! Pax. ! MTOW !! Cruise !! Range ! Engines !! {{Globalize|date=January 2018}} A '''corporate lawyer''' is a [[lawyer]] who specializes in [[corporate law]].<ref>{{cite book|title=No Contest: Corporate Lawyers and the Perversion of Justice in America|author=Ralph Nader and Wesley J. Smith|isbn=0-375-75258-7}}</ref>
==Roles and responsibilities == The role of a corporate lawyer is to ensure the legality of commercial transactions, advising corporations on their legal rights and duties, including the duties and responsibilities of [[corporate officer]]s. In order to do this, they must have knowledge of aspects of [[contract law]], [[tax law]], [[accounting]], [[securities law]], [[bankruptcy]], [[intellectual property rights]], [[licensing]], [[zoning law]]s, and the laws specific to the business of the corporations that they work for.<ref name=Princeton>{{cite book|title=Guide to Your Career|author=Alan B. Bernstein and Princeton Review Publishing Staff|chapter=Corporate Lawyer|date=2004|publisher=[[The Princeton Review]]|isbn=0-375-76399-6}}</ref><ref name=Vault>{{cite book|title=The Vault College Career Bible|author=Vault Editors|chapter=Corporate Law Basics|pages=289–290|date=2007|publisher=Vault Inc.|isbn=1-58131-419-1}}</ref> In recent years, controversies involving well known companies such as, [[Walmart]] and [[General Motors]] have highlighted the complex role of corporate lawyers in internal investigations, in which [[attorney-client privilege]] could be considered to shelter potential wrongdoing by the company. <ref>{{cite news|last1=Solomon|first1=Steven Davidoff|title=Keeping Corporate Lawyers Silent Can Shelter Wrongdoing|url=https://dealbook.nytimes.com/2014/08/26/keeping-corporate-lawyers-silent-can-shelter-wrongdoing/?_php=true&_type=blogs&_r=0|accessdate=30 August 2014|work=The New York Times|date=26 August 2014}}</ref> If a corporate lawyer's internal company clients are not assured of confidentiality, they will be less likely to seek legal advice, but keeping confidences can shelter society's access to vital information. <ref>{{cite journal|last1=Bishop|first1=Keith Paul|title=Why Keeping Corporate Lawyers Quiet Is Good For Us All|journal=The National Law Review|date=28 August 2014|url=http://www.natlawreview.com/article/why-keeping-corporate-lawyers-quiet-good-us-all|accessdate=30 August 2014}}</ref>
The practice of corporate law is less adversarial than that of trial law. Lawyers for both sides of a commercial transaction are less opponents than facilitators. One lawyer (quoted by Bernstein) characterizes them as "the [[handmaiden]]s of the deal". Transactions take place amongst peers. There are rarely wronged parties, underdogs, or inequities in the financial means of the participants. Corporate lawyers structure those transactions, draft documents, review agreements, negotiate deals, and attend meetings.<ref name=Princeton /><ref name=Vault />
What areas of corporate law a corporate lawyer experiences depend from where the firm that he/she works for is, geographically, and how large it is.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://brycelegal.com/2016/08/how-i-got-my-legal-dream-job-series-how-to-become-one-of-the-most-powerful-lawyers-in-new-york-state-government/|title=Intensive Practical Skills Training Build a Foundation for a Legal Career|last=|first=|date=|work=|access-date=2017-07-27|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|language=en-US}}</ref> A small-town corporate lawyer in a small firm may deal in many short-term jobs such as drafting [[will (law)|will]]s, [[divorce]] settlements, and real estate transactions, whereas a corporate lawyer in a large city firm may spend many months devoted to negotiating a single business transaction. Similarly, different firms may organize their subdivisions in different ways. Not all will include [[mergers and acquisitions]] under the umbrella of a corporate law division, for example.<ref name=Princeton /><ref name=Vault />
Some corporate lawyers become partners in their firms. Others become in-house counsel for corporations. Others still migrate into other professions such as [[investment banking]] and teaching law.<ref name=Princeton />
Some publications read by those in the profession include ''Global Legal Studies'', ''Lawyers Weekly'', and the ''[[National Law Journal]]''.<ref name=Princeton />
==Salary== The salary of a corporate lawyer can vary widely: those employed by major [[international]] [[law firms]] ("BigLaw" firms) earn starting salaries of US$180,000, which rise every year with experience (this amount excludes any additional bonus payments).<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/06/07/business/dealbook/law-firm-salaries-jump-for-the-first-time-in-nearly-a-decade.html?_r=0|title=Law Firm Salaries Jump for the First Time in Nearly a Decade|publisher=}}</ref> Depending on the geographical location, the starting salary may be closer to US$160,000 if the market is secondary.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/04/17/business/dealbook/welcome-to-your-first-year-as-a-lawyer-your-salary-is-160000-a-year.html|title=Welcome to Your First Year as a Lawyer. Your Salary Is $160,000.|publisher=}}</ref> Attorneys employed at smaller firms tend to earn smaller salaries.
== References == {{reflist}}
== Further reading == * {{cite book|title=Vault Guide to Corporate Law Careers|author=Zahie El Kouri|date=2003|publisher=Vault Inc.|isbn=1-58131-222-9}}
[[Category:Lawyers by type]] [[Category:Corporate law]]

{{refimprove|date=September 2009}}
'''Cost externalizing''' is a socioeconomic term describing how a business maximizes its profits by off-loading indirect costs and forcing negative effects to a third party. An externalized cost is known to economists as a [[Externality#Negative|negative externality]].
==Business to society== Fundamentally, cost externalization occurs when a company transfers some of its moral responsibilities as costs to the community directly or as degradation to the environment. For example, railroads and airlines transfer the cost of fuel, noise, and terminal infrastructure to the community. Airlines and auto manufacturers transfer the cost of degraded air quality to the community and the environment. By externalizing to the community or the environment, many true costs become lost in analysis because the true cost is non-quantifiable and neither the community nor the environment have effective advocates to recoup the damages. A major modern theme in the relationship of business to society is the society's ability (or inability) to resist this kind of externalization. In its extreme, society collapses as business realizes its profits.
==Business to market== Cost externalizing is one of the steps a company may take to "shape up" or reduce overhead by [[down sizing]] a [[cost centre (business)|cost center]] or an unprofitable department.
An example of cost externalizing would be using a global courier service (such as [[FedEx]] and [[United Parcel Service|UPS]]) to do all or most of the shipping and logistics work for the company. For a business to take on the responsibilities of worldwide shipping by itself would be too costly. It would be far more sensible to let a third party who specialize in shipping to take care of the task and pay them for it.
===B2B cost externalization=== {{Tone|section|date=August 2017}} Cost externalizing in no way should be considered a quick fix. Simply forcing suppliers and service providers to take on more responsibilities and cost is not a healthy externalization of cost. Careful operational forecasting must take place before taking steps towards cost externalization. Otherwise, there is no way to ascertain if cost externalizing would actually lower the operational cost of the company.
To externalize cost, [[budget]]ing must also take place. Because the company will be paying out to a third party, the cost would be more clear than when the process took place in-house. This would in turn give a chance for the suppliers and service providers to compete for business and may further reduce cost. Yet in some cases, the reduction in cost may lead to reduction in quality. Because quality is not quantified easily, it may be difficult to measure and compare - especially if the quality for all parties begin to fall, business managers may fail to notice the change in quality. This is one kind of control that a business loses when externalizing cost.
===B2C cost externalization=== Another option is for a company to transfer some of its costs to its customers. For example, reducing staff in a customer service department that handles incoming phone calls will usually increase hold times for customers seeking support. The company reduces its costs by reducing staff, while the customer bears the increased cost of waiting on hold. Thus an expense has been transferred from the company to the customer. This can reduce customer satisfaction, to the point that some customers will be motivated to switch to another company. However if the company can gain a legal monopoly (through, for example, intellectual property laws) the customer has no choice of a competitor available. The customer's only option then is to take it or leave it.
Customers can also absorb some of a company's costs by performing tasks that the company formerly provided. An early example of this was the self-service gas station, followed more recently by [[self checkout]] kiosks in grocery stores. This can have less of a negative customer satisfaction impact because some customers actually prefer to help themselves.
As in any business operation, costs externalization has its pros and cons. It is up to the business managers to make the decisions and take advantage of cost externalization.
==See also== * [[Cost accounting]] * [[Externality]] * ''[[The Story of Stuff]]'' * [[Tragedy of the commons]]
==References== * B{{Smallcaps|{{lc:udny}}}}, R. ; W{{Smallcaps|{{lc:infree}}}}, R. ''"Some Simple Arguments about Cost Externalization and its Relevance to the Price of Fusion Energy"''. 1999 Sep 27. [http://www.osti.gov/bridge/product.biblio.jsp?osti_id=12125 Office of Scientific and Technical Information] PDF avail.
{{DEFAULTSORT:Cost Externalizing}} [[Category:Costs]] [[Category:Socioeconomics]] [[Category:Management accounting]]

revision.text:
{{notability|Companies|date=April 2014}} '''Danish Open Source Society''' (abbreviated '''DOSS''') is working to promote [[open standard]]s and [[open source]]. The purpose of DOSS is to create tangible results through the work of the its members. DOSS has a very pragmatic approach and values tangible results higher than intangible principles. Most of the work of DOSS is done by a small group of very serious members.
As part of the DOSS-approach to promote Open Source, the society is behind a development project in [[Chinandega]] in the Northeastern [[Nicaragua]]. Open Source is here used to enhance the communication and learning in several villages. In that way DOSS is contributing, through the promotion of Open Source, to the improvement of the conditions of life in a specific area of the world.
This pilot project can be viewed as an integrated part of the overall strategy of DOSS on the promotion of Open Source and Open Standards.
==External links== * [http://www.doss.dk/ The website of Danish Open Source Society] * [http://folketinget.dk/Samling/20051/beslutningsforslag/B103/som_vedtaget.htm The Danish Parliament’s decision on Open Standards 2nd of June 2006]
[[Category:Business organizations based in Denmark]] [[Category:Free and open-source software organizations]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox NRHP | name =Women's City Club | nrhp_type = | nrhp_type2 = cp | nocat = yes | partof = [[Park Avenue Historic District (Detroit, Michigan)|Park Avenue Historic District]] | partof_refnum = 97000396 | designated_nrhp_type2 = May 13, 1997 | image = WomansCityClubDetroit.jpg | caption = | location= 2110 Park Avenue
[[Detroit]], [[Michigan]] | coordinates = {{coord|42|20|14|N|83|3|10|W|display=inline,title}} | locmapin = | area = | built =1924 | architect= William B. Stratton; Waldridge & Aldinger | architecture= [[Arts and Crafts movement|Arts and Crafts]],
[[Modern architecture#Early modernism|Early Modern]] | added = November 20, 1979 | governing_body = Private | refnum=79001179{{NRISref|2008a}} | designated_other1= Michigan State Historic Site | designated_other1_link = Michigan State Historic Preservation Office | designated_other1_date = April 29, 1979{{cite web|title = Women's City Club of Detroit |publisher = Michigan State Housing Development Authority|url = http://www.mcgi.state.mi.us/hso/sites/16601.htm|accessdate = September 3, 2010}} | designated_other1_num_position = bottom }} [[Image:WomensCityClubTilework.jpg|thumb|left|Tilework from [[Pewabic Pottery]] around front door of Women's City Club]] The '''Women's City Club''' is a women's club located at 2110 Park Avenue in [[Downtown Detroit|Downtown]] [[Detroit]], [[Michigan]], within the [[Park Avenue Historic District (Detroit, Michigan)|Park Avenue Historic District]]. It was listed on the [[National Register of Historic Places]] and designated a Michigan State Historic Site in 1979. ==History== [[Woman's club movement|Women's organizations]] became increasingly influential in the years after the [[American Civil War]] as a class of highly educated, middle class women arose in the nation.[http://www.detroit1701.org/Women's%20City%20Club.html Women’s City Club of Detroit] from Detroit1701.org Their impact was at its peak in the years around [[World War I]], when the 19th Amendment, guaranteeing women's suffrage, was ratified. In Detroit, it became apparent at that time that the many women's organizations in the city needed a centralized place to meet.[http://www.nps.gov/history/NR/travel/detroit/d21.htm Women's City Club] from the National Park Service In 1919, a number of local activists founded the "Women's City Club" to "promote a broad acquaintance among women."{{Cite book | author=Hill, Eric J. and John Gallagher | title=AIA Detroit: The American Institute of Architects Guide to Detroit Architecture | year=2002 | publisher=Wayne State University Press | isbn=0-8143-3120-3}} P. 62. The club hired architect William B. Stratton (husband of ceramicist and club member [[Mary Chase Perry Stratton]]) to design a suitable building; the structure was completed in 1924.{{Cite book | author= Sharoff, Robert | title=American City: Detroit Architecture, 1845-2005| publisher=Wayne State University Press| year=2005| isbn=0-8143-3270-6| authorlink= Robert Sharoff}} P. 41. ==Description== The exterior of the building is built of brick, in a featureless modern style. The six stories are differentiated into the lower three floors, which are blocky and regular; and the three upper floors, which appear to be set onto the lower floors. The brick color differs between the two sections, as does the appearance of the windows. There is also a horizontal range of bricks between the two sections. The lower floors were designed to be meeting spaces for social events and planning the activities of members. The three upper floors were used as an apartments for women who moved to Detroit for employment and wished to live in a wholesome environment. The interior decor was strongly influenced by the then-current [[Arts and Crafts movement|Arts and Crafts]] movement, with hand-wrought ironwork and [[Pewabic Pottery]] tilework. The swimming pool was also decorated with Pewabic tile. ==Use== The City Club offered a number of classes and recreation programs for women, eventually enrolling over 8,000 members. However, membership declined after [[World War II]], and in 1974 the club moved to smaller quarters. The social space was used for various purposes, including a restaurant and bar in later years. The building is currently owned by Forbes Management (also owners of the [[Elwood Bar]], [[Gem Theater]], and [[The Fillmore Detroit]]), and has recently received an upgrade of its façade.[http://www.modeldmedia.com/developmentnews/wex75.aspx "Women's City Club building on Park Ave. gets facade upgrades"] fropm ModelD, December 19, 2006 ==References== {{reflist}} {{Downtown Detroit}} {{Detroit}} {{National Register of Historic Places listings in Wayne County, Michigan}} [[Category:Clubhouses in Michigan]] [[Category:Women's club buildings]] [[Category:Buildings and structures in Detroit]] [[Category:Downtown Detroit]] [[Category:Clubs and societies in Michigan]] [[Category:Organizations based in Detroit]] [[Category:Women's clubs in the United States]] [[Category:Women in Michigan]] [[Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1922]] [[Category:Clubhouses on the National Register of Historic Places in Michigan]] [[Category:Michigan State Historic Sites in Wayne County, Michigan]] [[Category:National Register of Historic Places in Detroit]] [[Category:Historic district contributing properties in Michigan]]

{{Infobox person | image = | name = Douglas Harriman Kennedy | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1967|3|24}} | birth_place = [[Washington, D.C.]], [[United States|U.S.]] | education = [[Brown University]] ([[A.B.]]) | occupation = [[Journalist]] | party = [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] | spouse = {{marriage|Molly Stark|August 22, 1998}} | children = 5 | parents = [[Robert F. Kennedy|Robert Francis Kennedy]]
[[Ethel Kennedy|Ethel Skakel]] | family = [[Kennedy family|Kennedy]] }} '''Douglas Harriman Kennedy''' (born March 24, 1967) is the tenth child of [[Robert F. Kennedy]] and [[Ethel Kennedy]], named in honor of [[W. Averell Harriman]], a family friend and former governor of [[New York (state)|New York]]. ==Life and career== Kennedy was born in [[Washington, D.C.]] He married Molly Elizabeth Stark, daughter of John Sherwood Stark and Sharon Ellen Wing, on August 22, 1998, in [[Nantucket, Massachusetts]]. They have five children: Riley Maria Kennedy, born Aug 1999 in [[Nantucket, Massachusetts]]; Mary Julia Kennedy, born Aug 2001; Rowen Frances Kennedy, born Feb 2004; George Skakel Kennedy, born April 2007 and Anthony Boru Kennedy, born Jan 2012.{{cite news| url=http://articles.nydailynews.com/2012-02-25/news/31099346_1_stefan-friedman-maternity-ward-douglas-kennedy | location=New York | work=Daily News}} Kennedy graduated from [[Georgetown Preparatory School]] and [[Brown University]] and began his career as a print journalist with ''The Nantucket Beacon'' and later ''The [[New York Post]]''. As an investigative reporter for the Post, Kennedy obtained the first interview with the officer who arrested [[Oklahoma City bombing]] suspect [[Timothy McVeigh]] and broke numerous other health care and metropolitan area stories. He joined [[Fox News Channel]] as a general assignment reporter in August 1996 and hosts a bi-weekly program on the network, ''Douglas Kennedy’s American Stories''. While at Fox News, he covered the Presidential elections of 1996, 2000, and 2004, as well as [[Hurricane Katrina]].[http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,1218,00.html Fox News Biography of Doug Kennedy] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060427051237/http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,1218,00.html |date=April 27, 2006 }} dated July 14, 2006; accessed September 18, 2006. In 2006, while working as a correspondent for the Fox News show ''[[The Big Story (2000 TV series)|The Big Story]]'', he commented on the controversy over whether the film of "Crocodile Hunter" [[Steve Irwin]]'s last moments should be shown, noting that he and his siblings "had to grow up with" repeatedly seeing broadcasts and video clips of Kennedy's own father's death. He said that in Irwin's case, it would be really "unnecessary and in very poor taste."[http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,212321,00.html# Should Video of 'Crocodile Hunter' Steve Irwin's Death Be Released?] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061107071151/http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,212321,00.html |date=November 7, 2006 }} September 5, 2006 [[Associated Press|AP]] report on Fox site; must click "video" link in sidebar to see Kennedy's remarks. Video initially broadcast September 5, 2006. Accessed online September 18, 2006. On November 20, 2012, Kennedy was acquitted of misdemeanor physical harassment and child endangerment charges in connection with a January 7, 2012 altercation with two nurses at Northern Westchester Hospital in [[Mount Kisco, New York]], two days after his son, Daniel Boru, was born there.{{cite web |title=Douglas Kennedy, son of RFK, acquitted in NY maternity ward scuffle involving his newborn son |url=https://news.yahoo.com/douglas-kennedy-son-rfk-acquitted-ny-maternity-ward-201258681.html |publisher=The Associated Press |accessdate=November 20, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121128092617/http://news.yahoo.com/douglas-kennedy-son-rfk-acquitted-ny-maternity-ward-201258681.html |archivedate=November 28, 2012 |df= }}{{cite news|agency=Associated Press|title=Douglas Kennedy, son of RFK, acquitted in NY maternity ward scuffle involving his newborn son|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/national/douglas-kennedy-son-of-rfk-acquitted-in-ny-maternity-ward-scuffle-involving-his-newborn-son/2012/11/20/31199b64-334e-11e2-92f0-496af208bf23_story.html|publisher=The Washington Post|accessdate=November 20, 2012}} {{Dead link|date=April 2014|bot=RjwilmsiBot}}{{cite news|url=http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/nation/la-na-kennedy-20120226,0,3854060.story |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120227060729/http://www.latimes.com/news/nationworld/nation/la-na-kennedy-20120226,0,3854060.story |archivedate=February 27, 2012 }} Kennedy attempted to take his infant off the maternity ward for some fresh air, which two nurses said was against hospital policy, and who claimed that he physically assaulted them when they tried to stop him from doing so.{{cite web|last=Cusano|first=Art|title=Northern Westchester Hospital Defends Nurses in Kennedy Incident|url=http://tarrytown.dailyvoice.com/news/nwh-defends-nurses-kennedy-incident|publisher=The Tarrytown Daily Voice|accessdate=13 July 2012}}{{cite web|last=Birsh|first=Alex|title=Published Report: Kennedy, Nurses Clash At Northern Westchester Hospital|url=http://yorktown.dailyvoice.com/news/douglas-kennedy-nurses-clash-hospital|publisher=The Yorktown Daily Voice|accessdate=19 July 2012}} Kennedy was separately investigated by New York child welfare authorities following the incident, but social workers found no signs of child abuse in his home and declared the allegations unfounded in March 2012.{{cite news|url=http://www.seattlepi.com/news/article/AP-source-NY-finds-no-child-abuse-of-Kennedy-heir-3458994.php |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130202015200/http://www.seattlepi.com/news/article/AP-source-NY-finds-no-child-abuse-of-Kennedy-heir-3458994.php |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2013-02-02 |work=Seattle Post-Intelligencer }} ==See also== * [[Kennedy family]] * [[Kennedy family#Family tree|Kennedy family tree]] ==References== {{reflist|30em}} {{Robert F. Kennedy}} {{Kennedy family}} {{Fox News Personalities}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kennedy, Douglas Harriman}} [[Category:1967 births]] [[Category:American Roman Catholics]] [[Category:American television reporters and correspondents]] [[Category:Brown University alumni]] [[Category:American people of Dutch descent]] [[Category:American people of Irish descent]] [[Category:Kennedy family]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:New York Post people]] [[Category:Journalists from Washington, D.C.]] [[Category:Robert F. Kennedy]] [[Category:Fox News people]]
